column4: When I type two keys too fast on my keyboard (I am a fast typer) almost simultaneously, Ubuntu sometimes gets the wrong order
e.g. space always comes before any key
if another key is pressed too quickly before it
so I type thing slik ethi soften
try pressing all asdf keys together in any editor
even if you press it in reverse order but really fast
In Ubuntu 9.10, if you press the keys 'asdf' in the reverse order (f, d, s, a) but do it REALLY fast, you'll still get typed 'asdf' and not 'fdsa'.

In Ubuntu 9.10, if you press the keys 'asdf' in the reverse order (f, d, s, a) but do it REALLY fast, you'll still get typed 'asdf' and not 'fdsa'. For fast typers this is a problem as although we press a certain key before some other key timely, it still gets typed in the wrong position. So we have to slow down.
it's an interesting problem noone has noticed before
I SWEAR it's easy to try
